characters

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • characters.Enemy

  • public class Enemy
extends java.lang.Object
    Enemy provides use of the unnplayable characters that the MainCharacter has to defeat. It provides an array of all the names of the different enemies, as well as certain parameters required to battle them.

    Changes: The class now supports all aspects of combat, and no longer crashes on "Sneaky Assassin".

    Total Time Spent: 1.5 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Color col
      The color of the Enemy, required for battling in level 3.
      private int healthPoints
      The damage that needs to be dealt to defeat the Enemy.
      private Sprite image
      The visual representation of the Enemy.
      private java.lang.String name
      The name of the Enemy.
      static java.lang.String[][] NAMES
      All the possible names of the enemies.
      private java.awt.Image newImage
      The image after a single call of the draw function, with color added.

    • Field Detail

      • NAMES

        public static final java.lang.String[][] NAMES
        All the possible names of the enemies. The first layer represents the level they can be encountered in.

      • col

        private java.awt.Color col
        The color of the Enemy, required for battling in level 3.

        The damage that needs to be dealt to defeat the Enemy.

      • image

        The visual representation of the Enemy.

      • newImage

        The image after a single call of the draw function, with color added.

        The name of the Enemy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(java.awt.Color col,
             int healthPoints,
             java.lang.String name)
        Defines all the parameters of the Enemy.
        Parameters:
        col - Color of the Enemy.
        healthPoints - health of the Enemy.
        name - name of the enemy. Only use this in conjunction with NAMES.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int damage)
        Deals damage to the Enemy. Used after a spell cast.
        Parameters:
        damage - the damage caused by the spell

      • compareColor

        public int compareColor(java.awt.Color newCol)
        This calculates damage dealt by a spell, by taking differences in hue.
        Parameters:
        newCol - the color of the spell cast.
        Returns:
        The total damage dealt by the spell.
